comments:
CHEM242 is a continuation of CHEM241: A fundamental course in organic
chemistry based upon the modern concepts of structure and mechanism of reaction.
The course was seen as very hard, with one student saying that it was the “most
difficult course” of their college career. Almost all students found the material “difficult”
and the pace “quick,” but also found the course highly fulfilling.
Professor Dailey was unanimously praised by his students. He was described as
“very kind,” “interesting,” and “very open to questions.” Students also felt that Professor
Dailey was an “amazing lecturer” and “phenomenal.”
The prerequisite for this course is CHEM241. Exams were described as very
challenging and difficult to complete within the 50 minute time slot.
